name: exa
title: Exa AI
description: Use the Exa AI API to search the web and get AI-powered answers
author: abizer

commands.name: answers
commands.title: Exa Answers
commands.description: Ask a question using the Exa Answers API

commands.name: search
commands.title: Exa Search
commands.description: Search the web using Exa's semantic search engine

commands.name: similar
commands.title: Exa Similar
commands.description: Find web pages similar to a given URL

commands.name: search-in-browser
commands.title: Search in Browser
commands.description: Opens the Exa Search in your browser.

tools.name: search
tools.title: Search
tools.description: Perform an Exa search given an input query and retrieve a list of relevant results as links, including a summary of the content.

tools.name: find-similar
tools.title: Find Similar
tools.description: Find a list of similar results based on a webpage's URL, including a summary of each result.

tools.name: get-contents
tools.title: Get Contents
tools.description: Retrieves the full text of a webpage given its URL.

tools.name: get-answer
tools.title: Get Answer
tools.description: Get an answer to a question informed by Exa search results.

preferences.name: apiKey
preferences.title: Exa API Key
preferences.description: Your Exa API key from exa.ai

preferences.name: model
preferences.title: Exa Model
preferences.description: The Exa model to use for answers

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
